pkgmetadata.longdescription: Horcrux is a virtualization management platform built specifically for Gentoo Linux. It provides a modern web-based interface and REST API for managing virtual machines and containers using various backends. Supports QEMU/KVM, LXD, Incus for VMs, and LXC, Docker, Podman for containers. Think of it as a Gentoo-native alternative to Proxmox VE with fine-grained USE flag control.

use.flag: Enable QEMU/KVM virtual machine support (enabled by default)
Enable LXD support for both VMs and containers
Enable Incus support for both VMs and containers (LXD fork)
Enable LXC container support (enabled by default)
Enable Docker container support (enabled by default)
Enable Podman container support (daemonless Docker alternative)
Enable backup and restore functionality for VMs and containers
Enable clustering support via Corosync for high availability
Build and install the web-based management interface (enabled by default)
